Requesting historical probate documentation and microfilm records

title: Counselor-to-Student Ratios and Compensation (Dallas ISD)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Under the Texas Public Information Act, I respectfully request access to the following records related to mental health and counseling services for the current fiscal year (FY 2025–2026) and the past (2024-2025):
1. Counselor-to-student ratios:

Current counselor-to-student ratios for each grade level (elementary, middle, and high school), disaggregated by campus if possible.

2. Mental health staffing data:

The total number of full-time and part-time employees working in:

Counseling Services

Mental Health Services

School-based social work or wellness roles

3. Salary information:

The current salary schedule for counselors and mental health professionals.

Average and median salaries for each of the above roles, or the pay grade ranges assigned to each position title.

4. Staffing trends

If available, a comparison of these figures with the previous fiscal year (FY 2024–2025).

Please provide the information in digital format (PDF or spreadsheet is preferred). If any portion of this request is unclear or would require significant cost, I am happy to clarify or narrow it.

Thank you for your time and attention. I look forward to your response within the time frame required by law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gabriela Villegas

title: Sly Stone

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Sly Stone
communications.communication:
Dear FBI:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED

I request all records related to funk musician Sly Stone. He was born on 15 March 1943 in Denton, TX and died on 9 June 2025.

OTHER NAMES USED

The subject was born Sylvester Stewart.

PROOF OF DEATH

I have attached the subject's news obituary from NPR.

SCOPE OF SEARCH

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center and the Central Records Complex (CRC) in Winchester/Frederick County, Virginia. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed or transferred to NARA, please produce all records related to the transfer or destruction.

FEES

I have no commercial interest in this request, and all records produced in response to this request will be made available immediately to the general public online, for free, via muckrock.com. Please notify me before processing this request if you expect fees to exceed $25.

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

title: VMI URP Funding

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of all response(s) to FOIA #25-65 listed on the VMI FOIA Website and any subsequent records released in response to that FOIA or any follow-ups the party that submitted the FOIA may request to include any that may require a new FOIA number.

2. A copy of records showing the distribution of Pell Grants by race and Gender, also by athlete and non-athlete, if the athlete information is available, for the following academic years:

2020 - 2021
2021 - 2022
2022 - 2023
2023 - 2024
2024 - 2025.

My previous FOIA request included all federal funds, so if the Pell Grant information is included in that response, it is acceptable.

3. A FOIA response posted on another Virginia Government site indicates that VMI received $3,832,025 in 2024 and $398,250 in 2025, totaling $4,230,275 under the Pell Initiative for Virginia (PIV). In Maj. Gen. Wins' public statement after the VMI BOV voted not to extend his contract, he identified this funding as one of his significant accomplishments, although he did not mention the Virginia Program by Name. The Virginia public records show VMI reported expending approximately $55,000 to payoff the outstanding tuition bills for some cadets ("VMI requests $55,000 to support the payment of past-due and summer balances"). I am requesting records showing the racial, ethnic and gender breakdown of those cadets.

4. Also from other Virginia documents:

a. "faculty stipends to provide oversight for additional Group Study Sessions (GSS)." - who received the stipends and what events did the oversee (by name) for all rounds of the grant
b. "Establish a CAARE Team at VMI." - Who are the members, and what is the team's mission? for all rounds of the grant
c.  "Financial aid to Pell eligible Virginians" - I am requesting records showing the racial, ethnic and gender breakdown of those cadets for all rounds of the grant
d. "Application Fee Waivers" - I am requesting records showing the racial, ethnic and gender breakdown of those cadets for all rounds of the grant
e. "MAC-Sponsored study events" - what were these events, who conducted them, and any information on what the events covered as well as a cost breakbdown by event for all rounds of the grant.
f. STP Scholarships -  I am requesting records showing the racial, ethnic and gender breakdown of those cadets for all rounds of the grant.
g. Targeted Name Purchase - records describing what this product or service is for all rounds of the grant.

For any funds paid to outside entities, the name of those entities, the amounts paid to them, and the services for which they were paid.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: International Child Welfare Communications - Hague Convention Consultation Records

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: International Child Welfare Communications - Hague Convention Consultation Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Requesting two specific categories of records related to my request for assistance regarding international child welfare matters:


1. Documentation of my contact with the State Department circa 2002-2003 regarding my request for assistance with international child welfare concerns

2. Copy of the Department's response letter sent to me in 2004 providing Hague Convention information and procedures


Background: Following my child's extended absence from the United States when taken by his mother and grandmother to Kilmarnock, Scotland in July 2002 - an area known for high crime rates and drug activity - I contacted the State Department seeking guidance on Hague Convention procedures for legally securing my child's return to the United States. The prolonged international absence in this location created significant concerns about my child's welfare, safety, and unknown living conditions. The Department appropriately and professionally responded with educational information about Hague Convention processes and international child welfare protections.

This request serves family documentation purposes and focuses specifically on the initial request for assistance and the Department's professional and comprehensive response providing legal guidance.

Fee waiver requested for personal correspondence records and family documentation research.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Justin Kashuba

communications.subject: Status Update for Request #F-2025-19892 with U.S. Department of State
communications.communication:
Dear Justin  Kashuba, 

The status of your FOIA request #F-2025-19892 has been updated to the following status 'Received'. To learn more, you may log into the DoS FOIA Portal via the Application URL at https://pal.foia.state.gov. 
If that status is "On Hold", please review the email you received and provide the requested information. If you did not receive an email, please contact the FOIA Requester Service Center via email at FOIAStatus@state.gov. (mailto:FOIAStatus@state.gov) 
If that status is "Closed" or "Documents Delivered", then the Department's response will be emailed or mailed (via US Postal Service). Please check your email account (including junk/spam mail) for the Department's response OR allow 7 to 10 business days to receive the Department's response by US Postal Service mail.
Regards, 
U.S. Department of State

communications.subject: Ref: F-2025-19892
communications.communication:
Dear Justin Kashuba: 

This acknowledges you information access request to the U.S. Department of State.  Your request number is F-2025-19892. You will find additional information such as the date your request was received and your request status in your electronic portal page under this case number. 

If you requested expedited processing, a fee waiver, or if unusual circumstances apply, you will receive additional correspondence from us. 
For further assistance or to discuss any aspect of your request, you may contact our FOIA Requester Service Center or our FOIA Public Liaison via email to FOIAStatus@state.gov or by telephone at (202) 261-8484. (mailto:FOIAStatus@state.gov)
Regards, 
Office of Information Access Liaison 
Information Access Programs 
U.S. Department of State

title: Detroit Destruction of Animal Reports 2024-2025

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

title: José Alberto "Pepe" Mujica Cordano (20 May 1935 – 13 May 2025)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: José Alberto "Pepe" Mujica Cordano (20 May 1935 – 13 May 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into former Uruguayan president José Alberto "Pepe" Mujica Cordano (20 May 1935 – 13 May 2025). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his obituary in The New York Times at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2025/05/13/obituaries/jose-mujica-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: Phoenix Immigration Court public access (Department of Justice, Office of the Attorney General)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any communications between the Federal Agencies Or Officials (defined below) and the Real Estate Company (defined below) on or after January 1, 2025.

2. Any contract (including any leasing agreement) between the Federal Agencies Or Officials and Transwestern Real Estate Services.

3. Any contract (including any leasing agreement) involving 270 N. 7th Ave., Phoenix, AZ 85007. This request is limited to contracts involving the use of property or facilities at that location. 

"Federal Agencies Or Officials" means and includes: The U.S. Department of Justice; the General Services Administration; any employee of the Immigration Court located at 270 N. 7th Ave., Phoenix, AZ 85007. 

"Real Estate Company" means and includes (a) Transwestern Real Estate Services; (b) any company or person who owns or leases the property located at 270 N. 7th Ave., Phoenix, AZ 85007; and (c) any employee or agent of (a) or (b).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Joseph Jean-Pierre Marc Garneau (February 23, 1949 – June 4, 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into astronaut and former Canadian foreign minister Joseph Jean-Pierre Marc Garneau (February 23, 1949 – June 4, 2025). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his obituary in The New York Times at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2025/06/05/world/canada/mark-garneau-canadian-astronaut-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: Dennis Perkins AG Investigation Files

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Dennis Perkins AG Investigation Files
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law (La. R.S. 44:1 et seq.), I hereby request the following records:

Any and all investigations files, reports (probable cause documents, affidavits, supplemental reports, arrest reports, case summaries, related to Dennis Perkins (DOB: April 4th, 1975), including but not limited to any case(s) involving Cynthia Perkins, generated, handled, or received by the Louisiana Attorney General’s Office. 

This request includes but is not limited to:

Arrest records and affidavits,

Search warrants, digital forensic reports,

Internal and external communications with the Livingston Parish Sheriff’s Office, FBI, DOJ, or other entities, 

Plea discussions, or disposition summaries, 

Chain of custody records documenting the transfer or handling of evidence, especially between the Livingston Parish Sheriff’s Office and the Attorney General’s Office.

I am not requesting any explicit media files, photographs, or video content, particularly anything involving juveniles. This request it strictly limited to written or administrative documentation. 

I prefer to receive electronic copies of all records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Codey Albritton

title: Records relating to Targeted Justice

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Sirs:

This letter constitutes a request under the Privacy Act/ Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, on behalf of the Targeted Justice, Inc., tax id 66-xxx3099. You should search all files, including those in "Prohibited" or "Restricted" Access or its equivalent.  The records requested may be associated to of the following variations of my name or identifying information:

Targeted Justice, Inc., ("TJ"), a Texas and former Arizona corporation.
Targeted Justice, targetedjustice.com, targetedjustice.substack.com
Current address: PO Box 15990, Houston, TX 77220

Definitions

The term “record” is to be liberally construed to include: any 1) sound or voice recording, 2) photographs (.png, .jpg. .jpec, .tiff or any other photograph formats), 3) video, 4) text message,
5) mobile/web app messages and social media posts (from applications such as X, Facebook, Messenger, Whatsapp, Signal, Telegram, etc.) 6) email, 7) web page and blog captures and archives, 8) paper, computer or digital file, 9) spreadsheet, 10) paper, 11) microfilm, 12) digital archive, 13) x-Rays or imaging, 14) document or any other format where the information sought may be stored. The term “record” includes both the principal record responsive to the request as well as any studies, exhibits, supporting documentation or supplement thereof.

Records Requested:

I request the production of a copy of the all records (as defined above) in your possession relating to the Targeted Justice, including all the varieties of her identifying information set forth in section I above:

All correspondence, including criminal complaints, and prior Freedom of Information Act requests by TJ.

All responses from the FBI to all correspondence, criminal complaints, and Freedom of Information Act requests by TJ.

Al FISA warrants, renewals obtained and/or executed against TJ from January 1st 2004 until December 2024, and every record generated as a result of each one including, but not limited to the inventory of surveillance carried out and summary of each.

All photographs, videos, images, or any other media depicting the image of anyone associated to TJ or in a TJ event, from January 1, 2018 to the present, whether authorized by TJ or not.

All voice or sound recordings, voice or text messages sent or received through any phone line, cell phone or application, including the actual or reproduced voice of any TJ official, volunteer or representative that were made with or without TJ's knowledge or consent.

All “Sneak and Peak” warrants issued, requested and/or executed against TJ or its officials, Board Members or representatives, including, but not limited to: inventory of items seized, date, place. and custodian thereof for each one.

All FD-930 or its equivalent for organizations forms filled out and submitted to nominate TJ to the Terrorist Screening Database or any list of terrorist organizations.

Complete expense records and ledgers reflecting expenses, payments, fees, purchases, professional services paid or any other disbursement carried out in any matter relating to TJ.

Inventory and chain of custody records of all property seized or removed from TJ property or vehicles with or without a warrant.

Records of correspondence and instructions exchanged with, agreements entered into, payments, gifts, disbursements, reimbursements, payment of relocation and moving expenses, gift cards, any kind of benefit, credits, motor vehicles, or any other kind of compensation given to the any individual relating to their work, endeavor, mission, operation, stalking, harassment, surveillance, defamation, and/or any other activity relating to, or involving, regarding or about TJ or any of its directors Richard Lighthouse, Leonid Ber, Sally Priester or attorney Ana L. Toledo  carried out by anyone. Provide any other record pertaining to benefits, payments, credits, transfers, compensation to anyone not listed in relation to any endeavor relating to TJ.

Inventory of property seized from, occupied, removed from, or otherwise taken away from tj or from any of its offices, or those of its directors or officials.

Inventory or list of payments, financial contributions, assets, property, gifts, money transfers, obtained in relation to surveillance perpetrated against TJ by any federal agency,

Records obtained from any of TJ computers, email, or social media accounts, web or smart phone applications, or phone.

Records of payments, bartering, financial contributions, checks, money orders, bank transfers, gifts, donations or any other kind of economic transaction made by any person, corporation, research institution, or organization including the United States Government in compensation or payment of any torture, harassment, surveillance of and/or data harvesting from/against TJ.

FORM OF RECORDS
To minimize reproduction costs, I ask that you provide all records in digital form.

As you know, FOIA requires agencies to release information unless it is specifically exempt from disclosure, and also requires agencies to release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of documents, i.e., to redact exempt portions of documents and release the rest. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(8).

For any document you know exists but do not have, please provide name of agency and contact information to request it from.

The undersigned requests that your agency adheres to the legal mandate contained in 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i); see 28 C.F.R. § 16.6(b), (c) and consequently produce within 20 days of receipt of this request the information sought.

Expedited Processing Request

Targeted Justice publishes a newsletter in targetedjustice.substack.com. It currently has over 21,000 subscribers and over 227,000 views per month. Pursuant to 47 CFR 0.466, Targeted Justice qualifies as a member of the news media that provides information of public interest to its subscribers. Thus the information sought is not deemed for commercial use. Id. TJ's status as a member of the media warrants the expedited processing of this request on the grounds that there is a compelling need for these records because the information requested is urgently needed in the endeavors of disseminating information in order to inform the public about actual or alleged Federal Government activity. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E)(v)(II); see also 22 C.F.R. § 171.12(b)(2); 28 C.F.R. § n16.5 (d)(1)(ii); 32 C.F.R. § 286.4(d)(3)(ii); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.34(c)(2).

The records and documents requested relate to a “breaking news story of general public interest”. Furthermore, they present a “matter of widespread and exceptional media interest in which there exist possible questions about the government’s integrity which affect public confidence”. Expedited processing is warranted when “the information is relevant to a subject of public urgency concerning an actual or alleged Federal government activity.” Id.

In light of the above, TJ requests that your agency adheres to the legal mandate contained in 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i); see 28 C.F.R. § 16.6(b), (c) and consequently produce within 20 days of receipt of this request the information sought.

Request for Fee Waiver

Targeted Justice hereby requests a fee waiver of search, review, and duplication fees on the grounds that disclosure of the requested records is “in the public interest because it is likely to significantly contribute to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester.” See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii); see also 22 C.F.R. § 171.17(a); 28 C.F.R. § 16.11(k); 32 C.F.R. § 286.28(d); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.13(b)(2). Furthermore, a waiver of search and review fees is warranted inasmuch as the TJ will report the results of this endeavor as a “representative of the news media” and that the records are not sought for commercial use. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii))(7); 32 C.F.R. §§ 1900.02(h)(3), 1900.13(i)(2).

 For any document you fail to produce, TJ requests that you provide a Vaughn Index and declaration setting forth reasonably detailed explanations for each withheld document as to why it falls within any statutory exemption. See Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F. 2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973). The Vaughn statement must specify details about each document's sender, recipients, date and time, and subject.

If you need to discuss this request, the undersigned can be reached at (phone number). Thank you for your consideration of my request.
Sincerely, 

Targeted Justice
281-772-2668
247tj@proton.me

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Targeted Justice

Complete expense records and ledgers reflecting expenses, payments, fees, purchases, professional services paid or any other disbursement carried out in any matter relating to TJ.

Toledo  carried out by anyone. Provide any other record pertaining to benefits, payments, credits, transfers, compensation to anyone not listed in relation to any endeavor relating to TJ.

Inventory of property seized from, occupied, removed from, or otherwise taken away from tj or from any of its offices, or those of its directors or officials.

Inventory or list of payments, financial contributions, assets, property, gifts, money transfers, obtained in relation to surveillance perpetrated against TJ by any federal agency,

Records obtained from any of TJ computers, email, or social media accounts, web or smart phone applications, or phone.

FORM OF RECORDS
To minimize reproduction costs, I ask that you provide all records in digital form.

As you know, FOIA requires agencies to release information unless it is specifically exempt from disclosure, and also requires agencies to release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of documents, i.e., to redact exempt portions of documents and release the rest. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(8).

For any document you know exists but do not have, please provide name of agency and contact information to request it from.

The undersigned requests that your agency adheres to the legal mandate contained in 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i); see 28 C.F.R. § 16.6(b), (c) and consequently produce within 20 days of receipt of this request the information sought.

Expedited Processing Request

Targeted Justice publishes a newsletter in targetedjustice.substack.com. It currently has over 21,000 subscribers and over 227,000 views per month. Pursuant to 47 CFR 0.466, Targeted Justice qualifies as a member of the news media that provides information of public interest to its subscribers. Thus the information sought is not deemed for commercial use. Id. TJ's status as a member of the media warrants the expedited processing of this request on the grounds that there is a compelling need for these records because the information requested is urgently needed in the endeavors of disseminating information in order to inform the public about actual or alleged Federal Government activity. The records and documents requested relate to a “breaking news story of general public interest”. Furthermore, they present a “matter of widespread and exceptional media interest in which there exist possible questions about the government’s integrity which affect public confidence”. Expedited processing is warranted when “the information is relevant to a subject of public urgency concerning an actual or alleged Federal government activity.” Id.

Request for Fee Waiver

Targeted Justice hereby requests a fee waiver of search, review, and duplication fees on the grounds that disclosure of the requested records is “in the public interest because it is likely to significantly contribute to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester.” See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii); see also 22 C.F.R. § 171.17(a); 28 C.F.R. § 16.11(k); 32 C.F.R. § 286.28(d); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.13(b)(2). Furthermore, a waiver of search and review fees is warranted inasmuch as the TJ will report the results of this endeavor as a “representative of the news media” and that the records are not sought for commercial use. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii))(7); 32 C.F.R. §§ 1900.02(h)(3), 1900.13(i)(2).

 For any document you fail to produce, TJ requests that you provide a Vaughn Index and declaration setting forth reasonably detailed explanations for each withheld document as to why it falls within any statutory exemption. See Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F. 2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973). The Vaughn statement must specify details about each document's sender, recipients, date and time, and subject.

Sincerely, 

Targeted Justice
281-772-2668
247tj@proton.me

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Targeted Justice

title: 911 and Dispatch Activity: Harrison Ave, Northampton St, Reed St, and Surrounding Intersections

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: 911 and Dispatch Activity: Harrison Ave, Northampton St, Reed St, and Surrounding Intersections
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Computer-Aided Dispatch (CAD) logs and 911 call summaries for all calls from January 1, 2022 to present involving:

* The full range of 847 to 923 Harrison Avenue, including but not limited to: 873, 875, 877, 879, 881, 883, 885, 887, 889, and 905 Harrison Avenue
* All addresses on Reed Street
* 35 Northampton Street
* Intersections at:

  * Harrison Ave & Northampton St
  * Harrison Ave & Trask St
  * Harrison Ave & East Lenox St
  * Reed St & Northampton St

Please include the date and time of each call, the type of call (including but not limited to: drug use, drug dealing, overdoses, narcotics possession, suspicious activity, assault, robbery, trespassing, loitering, and public disturbances), the final disposition (e.g., report filed, arrest made, cleared, no action), and any associated incident or case numbers.

2. Incident reports, related to the above CAD calls, particularly any involving drug activity, overdoses, assaults, robberies, or related public safety issues.

3. Internal communications (emails, memos, or reports) from January 1, 2022 to present between District D-4 officers or supervisors, BPD Legal Division, BPD Communications Office, the Mayor’s Office, or the Coordinated Response Team, referencing:

* Drug activity or repeat incidents in the listed locations
* Guidance or policy related to not arresting for narcotics violations
* Community concerns or public/media strategy regarding drug activity or enforcement near Mass and Cass

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

title: Harrison Avenue / BWSC Parking Lots project

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Harrison Avenue / BWSC Parking Lots project
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request the following records related to the Harrison Avenue / BWSC Parking Lots project (Map Amendment 789, Parcel 35, Phase One and any subsequent phases). I am not requesting final plans, applications, or board packets already posted online. I specifically seek non-published communications such as internal emails, memos, meeting notes, and text messages created or received between January 1, 2023 and the date this request is fulfilled.

1. All internal or external communications involving BPDA staff, City legal staff, or developers (including Dream Collaborative or Madison Park) discussing:

* Strategies to avoid Zoning Board of Appeals (ZBA) review
* Use of PDA designation or Urban Renewal overlays to bypass traditional zoning or appeal processes
* Decisions to phase the project under 50,000 square feet to avoid triggering Article 80 Large Project Review
* Any aggregation analysis across project phases under Article 80

2. All communications, internal memos, or analysis discussing whether the Harrison parking lot project should have undergone Large Project Review under Article 80, including debate about scope, timing, or whether other parcels should be considered part of the same project.

3. All communications (including email, text, or Teams/Slack messages) between BPDA staff or the Mayor’s Office of Housing related to implementation of the 10% homeless housing set-aside policy for this project. This includes discussions of:

* Whether the policy applies to Phase One or future phases
* Concerns about addiction, mental health, or service requirements for residents
* Site-level management or public safety considerations for set-aside units

4. Any emails, memos, or internal notes referencing whether to notify or exclude Worcester Square Area Neighborhood Association (WSANA), Chester Square, or other neighborhood groups near the site. Include any explanation for limiting notice or tailoring outreach away from legal abutters.

5. Any emails or discussions justifying why this project was treated as part of Plan Nubian despite being outside the published boundary, including any political or planning rationale for doing so.

6. Any internal communications regarding the collection or filtering of public comments, including:

* Use of template letters or coordination with third parties to submit public support
* Filtering of comments by zip code, abutter status, or affiliation
* Internal tallies or comment summaries distinguishing support vs opposition

Please provide the above records in digital form. If any part is withheld, provide a written explanation citing the applicable exemption under G.L. c. 4, § 7(26), and release any non-exempt portions.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

title: Commonwealth v. Chatman Case File, Custody Logs, and Exhibit Communications

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Commonwealth v. Chatman Case File, Custody Logs, and Exhibit Communications
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request the following records related to Commonwealth v. Demond Chatman, Suffolk Superior Court, Docket No. 0084CR10635:

⸻

1. The full case file maintained by your office

Date Range: January 1, 2021 – Present
Examples of responsive documents include but are not limited to:
	•	Charging documents, witness lists, trial prep memos, evidence inventories, correspondence with defense counsel, and internal notes.
	•	Redactions for exempt personal information are acceptable; withholding the entire file is not.

Reference: You have already confirmed possession of the case file in SPR25/0781 (Supervisor of Records Determination dated March 27, 2025).

⸻

2. Chain of custody and access logs for the above file and any related exhibits

Date Range: January 1, 2021 – Present
Examples of responsive documents include:
	•	Sign-out logs, staff check-in/out records, transfer receipts, internal tracking databases, memos noting custody changes, or Outlook calendar entries reflecting scheduled file reviews.

Justification: Your office stated in SPR25/0781 that:

“If the Clerk’s Office did supply this Office with the trial exhibits, we would need the specific date and time, as well as the employee to which they were distributed…”
This implies the existence of internal records logging staff handling and file movement.

⸻

3. Communications regarding trial exhibits

Date Range: January 1, 2022 – March 31, 2025
Between:
	•	Suffolk DA’s Office and Boston Police Department
	•	Suffolk DA’s Office and Suffolk Superior Court Clerk’s Office

Topics:
	•	Transmission, delivery, return, storage, or possession of trial exhibits or physical evidence related to Commonwealth v. Chatman

Responsive documents may include:
	•	Emails (from any @mass.gov or @boston.gov account), meeting invites, letters, or attached logs.
	•	Example: An email from a BPD detective requesting return of evidence or trial exhibits for court prep.

⸻

4. Any itemized inventory or tracking document listing what was in the case file at any point

If an internal case management system (like a database or scanned index) is used, I request a copy or printout showing:
	•	Documents present
	•	Date of entry
	•	Any withdrawal or transfer notations

Authority:
	•	See SPR25/0781 (March 27, 2025), where your office acknowledged the existence of the Chatman case file
	•	Custody and access logs are not exempt under G.L. c. 4, § 7(26); administrative records tracking file use are routinely disclosed

⸻

Good Faith Tip:

To assist with locating responsive records, this case was tried in Suffolk Superior Court between January 14 and January 24, 2022. Exhibits likely include body cam footage, police reports, or forensic evidence handled by ADA(s) assigned to the case.


Please acknowledge receipt. If clarification is needed, I am happy to confer by email. Thank you for your time and attention.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

title: VMI Religious Accomdations

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: VMI Religious Accomdations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records showing VMI's Religious Accommodations policies and schedules that demonstrate a commitment to ethnic diversity in religious and ethnic observances, and how they were implemented over the academic years indicated below. Specifically, the policies, regulations, furloughs, passes, excusal from military duties, classes, and other accommodations provided Cadets so they can participate in religious and ethnic observances in meeting the Chaplain Office's Missions to: 1.  Ensure free exercise of religion; and 2) Provide pastoral care regardless of religious affiliation. This request pertains to the academic years listed below. These include, without limitation, the policy and another process for cadets to take a week off (or other periods) to celebrate Ramadan, time off  and other accomodations for for Major religious holidays include those celebrated by Christianity, Judaism, Islam, Hinduism, Buddhism, and others (e.g. Christmas, Easter, Ramadan, Eid al-Fitr, Yom Kippur, Diwali, etc.)

Academic Years Covered:
2023 - 2024
2024 - 2025

While I understand the schedules of these events and the guidance in terms of "orders" or other instructions allowing cadets to take advantage of absences from the campus, classes are more likely than not internal records, if any of these policies are publicly posted I am willing to accept links to them so they do not have to be converted to files and sent and so reduce the workload required to fill this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: Untitled

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Derby Police Department,

Requesting any records, documents, and photographs related to Police Officer Thomas (Tommy) J. Kashuba, D.O.B. November 28 1936, who served with the Derby Police Department for approximately 20 years. As his grandson conducting family genealogical research, I am seeking to document his law enforcement career and preserve his service legacy.
This request continues my family genealogical research following my recent request for my grandfather's military service records through NPRC. I am seeking to document his complete public service career spanning both Army and police service. Due to family circumstances that led to my relocation from Connecticut in 1994, I have very limited family documentation of his career.
Records requested include:

-Personnel files and employment documentation
-Commendations, awards, and recognition records
-Photographs, official portraits, department photos, ceremonies
-Community service and public safety contributions
-Retirement or end-of-service documentation
-Funeral arrangements and Honor Guard ceremony records
-Military honors coordination documentation

Family Background: I was named after my grandfather (middle name Thomas), reflecting our close relationship before his passing when I was 11 years old. I still remember seeing grandpa Tommy on his beat which was near the Derby Green at that time. He seemed to know everyone in town and treated everyone with the same respect. In 1988 Tommy was struck with a sudden heart attack near Derby High School while off duty and died that night at Griffon Hospital. I was outside the room when he passed. Grandpa Tommy meant a lot to me. My own son is named Justin Thomas Kashuba II. We have very limited family documentation of his police service and am seeking to preserve his law enforcement legacy. He reportedly was involved in notable cases including at least one high-profile arrest during his career. 

Additional Service Honors: My grandfather received a police burial with Honor Guard and military funeral honors provided by U.S. Army personnel, reflecting his distinguished service in both military and law enforcement careers. My son and I would greatly appreciate any records related to his funeral arrangements, Honor Guard participation, military honors coordination, and ceremony documentation that may have been maintained by the department.

GENEALOGICAL PURPOSE: This request serves family heritage preservation and honors his dedication to public service possibly spanning 40 years combined military and law enforcement career.
Fee waiver requested for family genealogical research and public servant legacy preservation.

There is no way to express in words what my grandfather Tommy meant to me. If I missed any records that you feel are appropriate please provide them at your discretion.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Justin Kashuba

title: Disciplinary Statistics

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Disciplinary Statistics
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records containing the following statistics for the academic years indicated:

1. Number of Honor Court Complaints or referrals (by source, such as cadet, faculty, staff, other, if possible) to the VMI Honor Court by academic year, race, ethnic background, and gender (further broken out by race and ethnic background), also identified as athlete or non-athlete.

2. Number of the Honor Court Complaints in #1 that were investigated by the same demographic breakdown.

3. Number of Honor Court Investigations in #2 that where Honor Court Charges were referred to the Superintendent for trial by the same demographic breakdown and indicated as approved for further action or disapproved by the Superintendent by the same demographic Breakdown.

4. Number of Cadets charged by the Honor Court whose charges were dismissed by the Superintendent based on pre-trial motions or for other reasons (with reasons if available) by the same demographic Breakdown.

5. Number of Cadets charged by the Honor Court who pleaded guilty to the charges by the same demographic Breakdown and the time between charges and final case adjudication.

6. Number of Cadets charged and tried by the Honor Court and found innocent by the same demographic Breakdown and the time between charges and final case adjudication.

7. Number of Cadets charged and tried by the Honor Court, Found Guilty and dismissed by the same demographic Breakdown and the time between charges and final case adjudication.

8. Number of Cadets charged and tried by the Honor Court, Found Guilty, whose cases the Superintendent subsequently dismissed and allowed them to stay at VMI by the same demographic Breakdown.

9. Number of Honor Court Cases where the Honor Court charged cadets but the Superintendent used his authority to adjudicate the case while the Corps was away from VMI (Summer Break, Furloughs, etc.) under the authority granted to him by the changes to the Honor System to make it more equitable by the exact demographic Breakdown.

10. Number of Honor Court Convictions appealed to the Board of Visitors Appeals Committee, and the result (appeal granted or denied) by the same demographic breakdown.

Data requested for the following Academic Years

2019 - 2020
2020 - 2021
2021 - 2022
2022 - 2023
2023 - 2024
2024 - 2025

Previously, similar statistics were made public through the media and the Barnes and Thornburg Investigation report before the requested years. The outgoing VMI Superintendent highlighted his accomplishments in ensuring racial equity, specifically for Black cadets. Still, the VMI Board of Visitors has not released his performance data in response to questions raised regarding their decision not to renew his contract. Other public documents contain statements regarding his successful efforts to provide personal oversight, review in these areas, and offenses, and prevent biased application of disciplinary actions (particularly against Black Cadets) to ensure equity. This updated data is relevant for the public to know the impact of his involvement in these areas identified as issues in the investigation.

This request is specifically NOT requesting any Personally Identifying Information (PII) on any of the individuals involved. VMI no longer announces the names of cadets dismissed for Honor Violations and those involved in Honor Court Cases are strictly prohibited from disclosing the the identities of these cadets, so there is no situation where this general information, which it is reasonably expected must be maintained to meet the committments to equity in the One Corps, One VMI Plan, responses to the Barnes and Thornburg Report, and VMI's repeated Committment to making changes to the honor ssystem so it is more equitable woudl violated any current or former cadet's privacy.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: Family Military Heritage Research - Army Veteran Service Records

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Family Military Heritage Research - Army Veteran Service Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Requesting complete military service records for United States Army veteran Thomas J. Kashuba, D.O.B. November 28 1936, who served in the U.S. Army with estimated service from approximately mid-1950s through 1970s. As his grandson conducting family genealogical research, I am seeking his military personnel file and service documentation.

Records requested:

- Official Military Personnel File (OMPF)
- Service record and assignment history
- Military photographs and portraits
- Awards, decorations, and commendations
- Training records and military education
- Unit assignments and duty stations
- Discharge documentation


FAMILY BACKGROUND: My grandfather Tommy, served as an Army equipment/inventory specialist and I was told that he was stationed at a major base in Washington State. I was named after my grandfather (my middle name is Thomas), reflecting the close relationship we had before his passing when I was 11 years old. I have no surviving immediate family contact and possess no military service documentation or even photographs of his career.

GENEALOGICAL PURPOSE: This request serves family heritage preservation and military service legacy documentation.

Fee waiver requested for family genealogical research and military heritage preservation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Justin Kashuba

equipment/inventory specialist and I was told that he was stationed at a
major base in Washington State. I was named after my grandfather (my middle
name is Thomas), reflecting the close relationship we had before his
passing when I was 11 years old. I have no surviving immediate family
contact and possess no military service documentation or even photographs
of his career.

GENEALOGICAL PURPOSE: This request serves family heritage preservation and
military service legacy documentation.

Fee waiver requested for family genealogical research and military heritage
preservation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform
me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer
the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or
CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I
look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business
days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Justin Kashuba

FKKWGPLV

Filed via MuckRock.com
E-mail (Preferred): 187702-11045356@requests.muckrock.com

PLEASE NOTE OUR NEW ADDRESS
For mailed responses, please address (see note):
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 187702
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

being sent through MuckRock by the above in order to better track, share,
and manage public records requests. Also note that improperly addressed
(i.e., with the requester's name rather than "MuckRock News" and the
department number) requests might be returned as undeliverable.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Family Military Heritage Research - Army Veteran Service Records
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Bryan, 

Thank your expeditious and gracious response. My son and I are looking forward to memorializing grandpa Tommy's legacy in both the US Army and Police Career through our records acquisition efforts. 

I would like to bring to your attention that my submission here on Muckrock was directed at the NPRC when I made the request. There is a possibility that the email address was somehow mis-indexed on Muckrock or possibly mis-routed somewhere along the way. I just wanted to bring this to your attention and anyone else that it may benefit. 

Once again please accept my gratitude for your fast and professional response, 

Justin Kashuba

title: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order (Walla Walla Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse
